body: ### Ruoyu Wang Undergraduate Students(2012-now) Department of Systems Biology School of Life Sciences University of Science & Technology of China ###Basic Information - M/F: Male - Date of Birth: 7/12/1995 ###Academic Background - Bachelor of Science (2012 up to the present) - University of Science and Technology of China. - Transferring from School of Humanities and Social Science to School of Life Sciences in 2013 - Department: Systems Biology, Life Sciences ###Publications Xu, Q., **Wang, R***., Ghanam, A. R., Yan, G., Miao, W., & Song, X. (2016). The key role of CYC2 during meiosis in Tetrahymena thermophila. _Protein & Cell_, 7(4), 236-249.* Co first author ###Research Experience - Summer Research Internship, Innovation Centre for Cell Signaling Network, Xiamen University (Supervisor :Dr. Dawang Zhou), 2014 summer - Undergraduate Research Projects, School of Life Science ,USTC (Supervisor :Dr. Xiaoyuan Song) (2014- now) - Undergraduate Innovation Projects, USTC (Supervisor :Dr.Xiaoyuan Song)(2015- now) ###Conference - 18th Symposium of Committee for Protozoology, China Zoological Society, Yantai, Shandong, Aug 2015 ###Awards - The Third Prize Scholarship, USTC 2013-2014 - Outstanding Volunteer, STW 2014 ###Research Skills - Bioinformatics and Computational Biology : NGS(Next Generation Seqeuncing) data analysis e.g. RNA-Seq, ChIP-seq, Hi-C - Programming: Python, R, C/C++ - Molecular and Cell Biology Experimental Skills ###Research Projects and Interests ####Transciptome Profile Reveals a new Cyclin-CYC 2 function in DNA repair during meiosis in _Tetrahymena themorphila_ Knocking out _Tetrahymena thermophila_ strain of CYC2 gene paused at about 3hr during the conjugation stage.Such dramatic phenotype makes this strain a quite proper model for studying meiosis.We perform the RNA-seq on CYC2-KO. strain and WT strain on four different time,2hr,2.5hr,3hr,3.5hr. The transcriptome profile we've performed reveals that Cyclin 2 may play an essential role in DNA mismatch repair during _Tetrahymena Thermophila_ meiosis _Qianlan Xu_ , **_Ruoyu Wang_** ,_Xiaoyuan Song_(**Co First Author, April 2016 _Protein & Cell_**) **Figure 1: Time course analysis of progression of the nuclear events in delta CYC2** ####The 3D genome organization and transcriptional regulation of _Tetrahymena thermophila_ Recently, many researches revealed that chromosome interactions can regulate genes expression. Genes expression are regulated by locus control regions (LCRs) which may located far away from their target genes, but during different development or differentiation they may form long-range intra- or inter-chromosomal loops and localize genes within nuclear regions that favor transcription. We are interested in the three dimensional regulation of transcription. So we introduced Hi-C which can identify genome wide long range interactions in micronuclei of _Tetrahymena thermophila_. _Zhengyu Luo_, **_Ruoyu Wang_**, _Xiaoyuan Song_ **Figure 2: HiC chromatin interaction map of chr1 in _Tetrahymena thermophila_** ####High Order Chromatin Organization with Nascent RNA mediating To address the question that whether nascent RNAs correlate with chromosomal interactions at genome scale, we analyzed whole genome chromosomal interaction data (Hi-C data) and GRO-Seq (Global Run-on Sequence) data from the same cell line (IMR90) generated by Ren Lab at UCSD. Our results showed that nascent RNAs in nuclear positively correlate with Hi-C fragments both in chromosomal interaction number and interaction frequency. This phenomenon suggests that nascent RNAs might mediate chromosomal interactions genome-wide. **_Ruoyu Wang_**, _Qi Peng_, _Xiaoyuan Song_ **Figure 3: Construction of RNA Associated Chromatin Interaction Network** ####Disease Associated Genetic Variations and 3D genome Most of the diseased genetic variations happened in non-coding locus. Besides enhancer dysfunction caused by genetic variations, non-coding mutations may also contribute to high order chromatin structure reorganization. By combining Genome-wide Associated Study data and Hi-C data analysis, We've found a genetic variation loci which is highly associated with Schizophrenia located in Topological Associating Domains(TADs) boundary region. We hypothesized that this boundary region mutation could cause high order chromatin structure changed. And we are using CRISPR-Cas9 to simulate this mutation in normal neuronal cells and using 5C to test our hypothesis. **_Ruoyu Wang_**, _Ran Zhang_, _Xiaoyuan Song_ **Figure 4: The Genetic Mutation Overlapped TADs Boundary Region** ####Function and mechanism of histone Variant H2A.Y in macronucleus of _Tetrahymena thermophila_ _Qianlan Xu_ , **_Ruoyu Wang_** ,_Xiaoyuan Song_ **Figure 5: RNA-seq results of HTAY K.O.
